docs.snippet: Seattle, riding the best start in franchise history, made a dramatic goal-line stand in the final minute to beat St. Louis....
docs.lead_paragraph: Seattle, riding the best start in franchise history, made a dramatic goal-line stand in the final minute to beat St. Louis.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Seattle Seahawks beat St Louis Rams, 14-9; other football news noted.

headline.main: Goal-Line Stand Saves Seahawks in Win Over Rams
headline.print_headline: A Goal-Line Stand Saves The Seahawks

docs.snippet: Coach Rex Ryan skipped watching tape of the Cincinnati Bengals rolling over the Jets on Sunday, a move he used in 2010 after the Patriots embarrassed the Jets....
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Rex Ryan skipped watching tape of the Cincinnati Bengals rolling over the Jets on Sunday, a move he used in 2010 after the Patriots embarrassed the Jets.
docs.abstract: Coach Rex Ryan skips team watching tape of the Cincinnati Bengals rolling over the New York Jets, move he uses every time the Jets absorb a 40-point loss.

headline.main: Jets Forgo Film Review When Woes Are Obvious
headline.print_headline: Jets Forgo Film Review When Woes Are Obvious

docs.snippet: The Giants may not become a winning team but they are a different one now as new faces like Jon Beason, Will Hill, and Peyton Hillis have gained prominent roles....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Giants may not become a winning team but they are a different one now as new faces like Jon Beason, Will Hill, and Peyton Hillis have gained prominent roles.
docs.abstract: Bill Pennington On Pro Football column observes that while the New York Giants may not become a winning team this season, they are developing a winning attitude as new faces like Jon Beason, Will Hill and Peyton Hillis have gained prominent roles.

headline.main: If Not Yet a Winner, the Giants Are a Different Team
headline.print_headline: If Not Yet a Winner, the Giants Are a Different Team

docs.snippet: The St. Louis Rams played Monday Night Football at home for the first time since 2006, but the World Series remained at center stage....
docs.lead_paragraph: The St. Louis Rams played Monday Night Football at home for the first time since 2006, but the World Series remained at center stage.
docs.abstract: St Louis Rams played Monday Night Football at home on Oct 28, for the first time since 2006, but St Louis Cardinals and the World Series remain at center stage.

headline.main: Rams Cede Spotlight to World Series

docs.snippet: The settlements in the Jerry Sandusky child sexual abuse case have been unfolding since mid-August, but Penn State waited until Monday to announce them all at once....
docs.lead_paragraph: The settlements in the Jerry Sandusky child sexual abuse case have been unfolding since mid-August, but Penn State waited until Monday to announce them all at once.
docs.abstract: Penn State agrees to pay $59.7 million to 26 sexual abuse victims of the former assistant football coach Jerry Sandusky in exchange for an end to their claims against the university.

headline.main: Penn State to Pay Nearly $60 Million to 26 Abuse Victims
headline.print_headline: Penn State to Pay Nearly $60 Million To 26 Abuse Victims

docs.snippet: MICHALSON--Robert Lloyd, age 81 on October 26. Cherished husband of Nancy George-Michalson, devoted father of Debra (Michael) and Hope (Randy), loving grandfather of Stefanie, Brett and Haleigh and adored pets Callie and Melodie. Korean War vetera...
docs.lead_paragraph: MICHALSON--Robert Lloyd, age 81 on October 26. Cherished husband of Nancy George-Michalson, devoted father of Debra (Michael) and Hope (Randy), loving grandfather of Stefanie, Brett and Haleigh and adored pets Callie and Melodie. Korean War veteran. Golf, boating, backgammon, (and touch football), Bob was a true Champion. His warmth, charm, and friendship will be greatly missed by all who knew him. Donations in memory of Bob can be made to Ronald McDonald House- NY or Angel on a Leash, www.angelonaleash.org

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MICHALSON, ROBERT LLOYD

docs.snippet: Garry Kasparov, the former world chess champion who retired in 2005, will try to unseat the eccentric president of the World Chess Federation, Kirsan Ilyumzhinov....

headline.main: Kasparov Faces Obstacles to Leading Chess Federation
